column4: I'm trying to install ubuntu amd64 on an intel Core 2 quad. However, Whenever I get to run the live CD or try to install from the live CD, I get dropped to the initramfs prompt. What can I do to troubleshoot this situation. dmesg is giving me very few hints.
Try from an external USB cd drive

I had this exact issue on an Asus P5K board, it was the controller for the IDE/SATA which meant installer could not understand what device it was using to boot and drops to busybox. But usb cd works to at least get it running
when you said USB cd you mean a cd drive that connects via USB?
Correct. An external drive connected through USB port
hmmm, I don't have one of those.....
did you receive the message "no common CD-ROM device found."
I'm not getting that problem. Did you have SATA opticals? I have IDE opticals
I have IDE optical drives but the controller for it is integrated with the SATA controller and so it did not work out-of-box.
That's kind of bunk that I have to buy new hardware just to install Ubuntu
If you have some ancient hard drive cntroller card around it would work to use for installing.
you mean like a PCI IDE controller or something?
Like a Promise TX133 or something
and no, I don't have an IDE controller
As philh suggests perhaps try the alternate. It does have some more drivers on it like nvidia SATA controller drivers and marvell SATA controller drivers.
